page.title: 01THE UPPER LEVEN BASIN
page.content: THE AREA LIES TO THE WEST OF GLENROTHES.IT IS 95 % RURAL,ONLY A SMALL PRIVATE ESTATE IN LESLIE INTRUDING.THE PRINCIPAL FEATURE IS THE RIVER LEVEN VALLEY-NARROW TO THE EAST BUT FLAT AND WIDE TO THE WEST FLOWING FROM LOCH LEVEN.HERE THE RIVER WAS STRAIGHTENED BY BUILDING THE CUT IN 1832.THE SIDES OF THE VALLEY ARE STEEP AND CONTINUE TO RISE SHARPLY TO THE NORTH WHEREAS IN THE SOUTH THE RISE IS MORE GENTLE TO A MAXIMUM OF 192 M. MIXED FARMING PREDOMINATES WITH VERY LITTLE OTHER INDUSTRY APART FROM THE OPENCAST COALFIELD INTRUDING IN THE SOUTH.EVIDENCE OF FORMER INDUSTRY E.G. BLEACHFIELD STILL REMAINS.DESPITE HAVING VIRTUALLY NO AMENITIES THE SMALL POPULATION IS FAIRLY STABLE SINCE GLENROTHES WITH ITS WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES IS NEARBY.
